wikipedia_page.main: Douglas Charles Gordon Raikes (26 January 1910 – 27 March 1993) was an English cricketer. He played for Oxford University in 1931, Gloucestershire in 1932 and for Kent in 1948.

link_mentions.page: List of Gloucestershire County Cricket Club players
response: * Douglas Raikes (1932) : D. C. G. Raikes

Downton was born in Bexley in Kent in 1928. Along with Douglas Raikes, he acted as England wicket-keeper Godfrey Evans' deputy in Kent's 1948 side, playing first-team cricket when Evans was on Test duty.George Downton 1928 – 2014 – Obituary, Kent County Cricket Club, 2014-05-20. Retrieved 2017-05-30. His first-class debut came in June 1948 against Yorkshire at Bradford.George Downton, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2014-05-27. He played a total of eight matches for Kent's First XI during the 1948 season, his only season of regular first-class cricket.Downton, George Charles, Obituaries in 2014, Wisden Cricketers' Almanack, 2015. Retrieved 2017-05-30.
